themes: Negative impact of recent program changes on established organizations
Problems with panel review process and applicant representation
Concerns about exclusive identity-based funding priorities
Lack of applicant voice in correcting misinformation during review
key_phrases: changes that we have seen in the last 5 years have been detrimental
Disability is deemed a value in the new programming, but do the math
less than 1% and less than 4 organizations are funded this year
exclusive funding model prioritizes color, race, and LBTGQ over disability
program was designed too far from the center of the spectrum
panel process should also be considered for re-design
applicant has no voice to correct their errors
panelists from out of town are summarizing our projects
panelists selected to check boxes on equity
ask applicants to create a paragraph to represent their application
barriers_identified: Exclusive funding criteria based on identity groups
Disability organizations required to meet additional identity criteria
Panelists sharing misinformation with no applicant recourse
Panelists from outside the community lacking local context
solutions_proposed: Assign panelists with relevant lived experience to corresponding applicants
Allow applicants to submit a paragraph to be read by the primary reviewer
